page.title: 08Crawshay House
page.content: {CRAWSHAY HOUSE} This house was connected with the local iron works.They were opened in 1795 and were later bought by Crawshay and Joseph Bailey.By 1825 they had a worldwide reputation especially for the making of railways.In 1833 a new plate mill was built.Nantyglo became one of the most important iron producing works in the world. Crawshay Bailey built a house called Ty Mawr.It was surrounded by trees and gardens.Running through the garden was a mountain stream crossed by a stone bridge for the coach to go over.The stables are still visible.Joseph Bailey left the house in 1830 and retired to Glan Usk.Crawshay died in 1872.The Blaina Iron and Coal Company took it over.It fell into a ruined state during the twentieth century but is now being excavated for posterity.
